name: The Invisible Hours
summary: "The Invisible Hours is a complex murder mystery in VR, in which players freely explore an intricate web of interwoven stories within a sprawling mansion -- in order to untangle the dark truth at its heart."
storyline: "A group of strangers receive a curious invitation from enigmatic inventor Nikola Tesla, offering each of them the chance to make amends for their darkest wrongdoings. When the last guest arrives at Tesla’s isolated mansion laboratory, they find him dead – murdered. Disgraced Swedish detective, Gustaf Gustav, vows to find the killer amongst the other guests: a blind butler, a convicted murderer, the world’s most famous actress, Tesla’s former assistant, the son of a wealthy railroad magnate, and rival inventor Thomas Edison. But none of these people are what they seem."

esrb.synopsis: This is a VR adventure game in which players watch events of a murder mystery as it unfolds in a Victorian mansion in the late 19th century. Players can manipulate time (e.g., fast forward, rewind, stop) as they follow characters and listen in on their conversations. Some conversations can lead to various acts of violence: a woman stabbed in the chest with a knife; a man electrocuted by lightning; a man stabbed in the stomach. In one interaction, a character bleeds on the floor after being slashed across the neck by an assailant. Some interactions can also lead to suggestive innuendo and dialogue (e.g., "You want to make love to me"; “I'm not sure I can entertain all three of you at once”; “Us working girls never forget a face...You took me off the streets in Whitechapel, all the way up to that fancy hotel room.”). The game includes some alcohol references (e.g., “You are drunk,” “Perhaps you should lay off the booze,” and “You're nothing but a drunk.”); one character is depicted drinking whisky from a bottle. The word “b*tch” is heard in the dialogue.
